document_title: Erectile dysfunction: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
As you get older, your penis becomes less erect.
Some risk factors that can cause erectile dysfunction include:
People suffering from certain medical conditions such as diabetes or heart disease; People who smoke regularly. This habit will restrict blood flow to the veins and arteries, which over time can cause chronic diseases leading to erectile dysfunction.; People who are overweight or obese; People who have undergone certain medical treatments such as prostate surgery, cancer radiation therapy, etc.; People with penile injury, especially when the injury affects the nerves or arteries that control erections.; People being treated with medications including antidepressants, antihistamines, high blood pressure medications, and benign prostatic hyperplasia medications.; People who regularly use drugs and alcohol. Erectile dysfunction is especially serious for long-term drug users or heavy drinkers.; People with psychological problems such as frequent stress, anxiety or depression.
